title: Incoming email hijacking on sc-cdn.net
vulnerability_information:
Hey guys!

Really interesting find here.

### Summary
These dangling MX records on `sc-cdn.net` have allowed me to purchase an email account with GoDaddy (owner of these servers) and send/receive email from an account on this domain.

```
sc-cdn.net.		3599	IN	MX	0 smtp.secureserver.net.
sc-cdn.net.		3599	IN	MX	10 mailstore1.secureserver.net.
```

### Reproduction
As I now "own" this email URL on GoDaddy, in theory you can't register another email address yourself. To prove that I've taken it over, feel free to email me on `rubyroobs@sc-cdn.net` and I'll be able to paste the message I receive into here to prove ownership of it.

### Mitigation
Delete these DNS records to avoid mail being hijacked on this domain.

### Impact
I believe impact of hijacking incoming emails on this address far outweighs the smaller consequences of missing SPF records. This would allow me to setup accounts on this email and in some cases allow me to prove control of the domain or impersonation of Snapchat staff.

Been super fun investigating this - not my typical find honestly :D. Let me know if you need any help triaging!

Cheers,
@rubyroobs
vulnerability_information_html:
Hey guys!

Really interesting find here.

Summary

These dangling MX records on sc-cdn.net have allowed me to purchase an email account with GoDaddy (owner of these servers) and send/receive email from an account on this domain.

sc-cdn.net.     3599    IN  MX  0 smtp.secureserver.net.
sc-cdn.net.     3599    IN  MX  10 mailstore1.secureserver.net.

Reproduction

As I now "own" this email URL on GoDaddy, in theory you can't register another email address yourself. To prove that I've taken it over, feel free to email me on rubyroobs@sc-cdn.net and I'll be able to paste the message I receive into here to prove ownership of it.

Mitigation

Delete these DNS records to avoid mail being hijacked on this domain.

Impact

I believe impact of hijacking incoming emails on this address far outweighs the smaller consequences of missing SPF records. This would allow me to setup accounts on this email and in some cases allow me to prove control of the domain or impersonation of Snapchat staff.

Been super fun investigating this - not my typical find honestly :D. Let me know if you need any help triaging!

Cheers,
@rubyroobs

activities.message: Also, sorry to ask but is it possible to get a faster triage for this bug? I can get a refund on the email account ($115... GoDaddy pls) within 14 days of purchase. <3
activities.markdown_message: Also, sorry to ask but is it possible to get a faster triage for this bug? I can get a refund on the email account ($115... GoDaddy pls) within 14 days of purchase. <3

activities.message:
Hey guys!

To make this easier for you to triage I've changed the password of the email I created so you can login and verify yourself.

```
Webmail: https://login.secureserver.net
Username: rubyroobs@sc-cdn.net
Password: RRsccdn168476!
```

Please let me know if I can be of further assistance :)

Cheers,
@rubyroobs

activities.message:
Thanks for your report, @rubyroobs. We're able to reproduce your proof of concept. Our investigation is ongoing but we'll be sure to update you as soon as we have more information. 

Thanks and good luck in your future bug hunting.
activities.markdown_message:
Thanks for your report, @rubyroobs. We're able to reproduce your proof of concept. Our investigation is ongoing but we'll be sure to update you as soon as we have more information.

Thanks and good luck in your future bug hunting.

activities.message:
Hey @winston 

Thanks for owning this bug! Am I good to cancel my account with GoDaddy or do you prefer I keep it active until the records are removed?

Cheers,
@rubyroobs

activities.message: Hey @rubyroobs, feel free to cancel your GoDaddy. Thanks for reporting this! We're continuing to investigate but we'll be sure to keep you updated along the way. Thanks!

activities.message:
Hey @winston,

All is sorted with GoDaddy. The account is now closed and the order was refunded. Thanks for getting back to me so quickly so I could get the refund in time!

Cheers,
@rubyroobs
activities.markdown_message:

activities.message:
Hey @winston,

This issue now appears to be resolved! Digging for MX records on `sc-cdn.net` returns:

```
sc-cdn.net.		899	IN	SOA	ns-1914.awsdns-47.co.uk. awsdns-hostmaster.amazon.com. 1 7200 900 1209600 86400
```

Cheers,
@rubyroobs
